Tucson looks down to Silverbolt.  He had seen a shred of life and then noth=
ing.  He had always tried to keep his composure but he could not help but l=
et a tear of despair run down his right cheek.  

" No!  Silverbolt, don't =
do this to me!"

At first he doesn't answer Leo Prime.  Silverbolt was his =
priority now.  He quickly places a hand on Silverbolts chest and performs a=
n energy transfusion from his body to Silverbolt.  Yet his own reserves wer=
e not at a hundred percent either.  He didn't care, all he cared about was =
getting his friend back to the shuttle with what life he could give him.

A=
s energy flows from his body into Silverbolts Tucson begins to falter a bit=
 in mid air.  Yet as swift as he was in flight, he could see the shuttle ah=
ead.  But would he make it in time before his own system shut down?

" Just=
 a little more.   Almost there.   Leo Rodimus is not respondent at this tim=
e.  I - have not received word as - of yet."

He struggles to fight off the=
 urge to make an emergency landing.  Instead he uses the last of his reserv=
es to speed up his flight pace and is now just a few feet from the shuttle,=
 but losing altitude while doing so.

" Can't keep the altitude much longer=
.  I'm coming in.  Have the - shuttle ready for boarding..."

Perpetually o=
n the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 17, 2011, at 6:24 AM, Super Cyclon=
us <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson picks up the =
transmission and keeps a steady pace onward.
> >
> > " I copy Leo Prime. I =
will watch for the shuttle closely. I should meet up
> > with it within a f=
ew hours. I only wish I could fly faster."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "Understood." LE=
O PRIME came back with. "Any word on Rodimus?"
> 
> In TUSCON's arms SILVER=
BOLT stirred but never came fully conscious,
> his optics flickered on for =
a moment and then shut back off again.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-5-275057409
